snippet: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl told medical officials he was locked in a metal cage in total darkness for weeks at a time as punishment for trying to escape, according to officials briefed on his condition.
abstract: Sgt Bowe Bergdahl remains in military hospital in Germany without access to news media; Bergdahl has told medical officials some details about his time in captivity, but they have not yet focused on critical questions about why he left his outpost and how he was captured by insurgents.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl told medical officials he was locked in a metal cage in total darkness for weeks at a time as punishment for trying to escape, according to officials briefed on his condition.

headline.main: As Bowe Bergdahl Heals, Details Emerge of His Captivity
headline.print_headline: As Soldier Heals, Details Emerge of His Captivity
